metadata.title: CVE-2019-15791 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
In shiftfs, a non-upstream patch to the Linux kernel included in the Ubuntu5.0 and 5.3 kernel series, shiftfs_btrfs_ioctl_fd_replace() installs an fdreferencing a file from the lower filesystem without taking an additionalreference to that file. After the btrfs ioctl completes this fd is closed,which then puts a reference to that file, leading to a refcount underflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15791` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required
